bibl.title: Preludes of the Egyptian Revolutions against the Ptolemies and the Greeks.
bibl.note: Preludes of the Egyptian revolutions against the Ptolemies and the Greeks began in the early years of Philadelphus' reign, continued intermittently throughout that reign, and culminated in the first revolution in the early years of Euergetes I's reign, videlicet in 245 B.C.

bibl.title: Proceedings of the XIXth International Congress of Papyrology. II

bibl.seg: NOSHY Ibrahim, Preludes of the Egyptian Revolutions against the Ptolemies and the Greeks.
Proceedings of the XIXth International Congress of Papyrology. II (Cairo, 1992) pp. 373-420.

Preludes of the Egyptian revolutions against the Ptolemies and the Greeks began in the early years of Philadelphus' reign, continued intermittently throughout that reign, and culminated in the first revolution in the early years of Euergetes I's reign, videlicet in 245 B.C.
